string.name: rule1
string.b: Use the finger to put the active card on the board.\n The game begins with 72 cards that gradually run out.\n Cards can appear in 3 different shapes.

string.name: rule2
string.b: Cards can appear in 3 different colors.

string.name: rule3
string.b: Cards can appear in 4 different quantities.

string.name: rule4
string.b:
The object of the game:
 To position the cards in the matrix in a way that creates
 as many commonalities as possible. A line that has at least one commonality will disappear.
 Same color

resources.string:
The challenge:
 Achieving one or even two commonalties is pretty
 easy, but the real challenge strive for multiple
 commonalties. The best tactic is the "Tripod"
 The Tripod:
 The tripod tactic lets you close at least 3 commonalties at the same time.

Here is how: This Tripod is closed with one red cherry card.
 1. Focus on the quantity and place the cards in their columns.
 2. Leave the top left square empty and wait for a "One" to close the Tripod.
 Cleaning up To create multiple commonalties,
 you often need to gamble and wait for the right card.
 A card that doesnot support the Tripod should be placed in the blank zone.
 As the matrix gets full, and a Tripod is NOT achieved,
 you need to abandon the Tripod tactic and clean the matrix anyway you can.
 This will help you get ready for the next attempt at a Tripod.
 Improvisation:
 Although the Tripod is the most promising tactic, you will
 need to open your eyes (and your mind) to special situations
 where a different tactic should be used. 
 You will become aware of it as you play.
 The game ends when the matrix is full,
 or when you run out of cards.
